intro: Trilepis pilosa, commonly known as the hairy trilepis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a textured appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or brown, and they bloom in the spring and early summer. Trilepis pilosa is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
